async_info.video_title: Lebanon protests: 'I feel proud to be Lebanese' - BBC News
async_info.video_description:
Protests against the government in Lebanon are continuing, despite the army moving to reopen key roads.
The demonstrations that began on October 17 were sparked by a proposed tax increase.
Prime Minister Saad Hariri has presented a series of reforms but the protesters say that they will continue to rally until the government steps down.
Please subscribe HERE http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

comment_content.original_script: So a group of people stared protesting against new imposed taxes(supposedly ti fix the financial and economical crisis that they have freaking caused) like 6$ a month on whatsapp which is ridiculous because they don't even own whatsapp and we are already paying a lot of taxes and we never get anything in returns we don't even have electricity for the whole day for God's sake and we need to pay for generators and all. Anyways a convoy of a minister went straight through the protest and the body guard stared shooting a machine gun in the air to stop protestors which made the people angry (a women kicked the body guard in the nuts to stop him) bits by bits people started coming down to the streets to voice their opinion with no regards to their religion or political party (finally) and now there are 2 million lebanese in the streets (from a 4.5 million population) demanding for the resignation of the government because no one trusts them anymore and they've stolen from us and made us miserable one too many times. Also a factor that helped build up the tension is the way the government was uneffective while "handling" massive wildfires last week. We've had enough i can't even express in words how much i hate this government because they are ruining my country the country i love and we aren't going to stop until they leave the office, we want a transitional government to organize new elections for a new government to form, we want effective and educated candidates that don't come form legacy. The thing is the economical crisis in Lebanon isn't hard to manage but these politicians only care about what's in for them and about how they are going to steal all our money. So yeah it's safe to say we've had enough. To top it all the political parties who are in charge of the government are sending their supporters to the streets to disturb the protests and cause mayhem and that caused a lot of unnecessary injuries and brutality in order to discredit the protestors so yeah they're going down

Unto each, Allah has promised good (Paradise), but Allah has preferred those who strive hard and fight, above those who sit (at home) by a huge reward" Quran (5:33) - "The punishment of those who wage war against Allah and His messenger and strive to make mischief in the land is only this, that they should be murdered or crucified or their hands and their feet should be cut off on opposite sides or they should be imprisoned; this shall be as a disgrace for them in this world, and in the hereafter they shall have a grievous chastisement" Quran (8:12) - "(Remember) when your Lord inspired the angels... "I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve. Therefore strike off their heads and strike off every fingertip of them" Quran (8:15) - "O ye who believe! When ye meet those who disbelieve in battle, turn not your backs to them. (16)Whoso on that day turneth his back to them, unless maneuvering for battle or intent to join a company, he truly hath incurred wrath from Allah, and his habitation will be hell, a hapless journey's end." Quran (8:39) - "And fight with them until there is no more fitna (disorder, unbelief) and religion is all for Allah" Quran (8:57) - "If thou comest on them in the war, deal with them so as to strike fear in those who are behind them, that haply they may remember." Quran (8:67) - "It is not for a Prophet that he should have prisoners of war until he had made a great slaughter in the land..." Quran (8:65) - "O Prophet, exhort the believers to fight..." Quran (9:5) - "So when the sacred months have passed away, then slay the idolaters wherever you find them, and take them captive and besiege them and lie in wait for them in every ambush, then if they repent and keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate, leave their way free to them." Quran (9:20) - "Those who believe, and have left their homes and striven with their wealth and their lives in Allah's way are of much greater worth in Allah's sight. These are they who are triumphant." Quran (9:29) - "Fight those who believe not in Allah nor the Last Day, nor hold that forbidden which hath been forbidden by Allah and His Messenger, nor acknowledge the religion of Truth, (even if they are) of the People of the Book, until they pay the Jizya (mafia protection tax) with willing submission, and feel themselves subdued." Quran (9:38-39) - "O ye who believe! what is the matter with you, that, when ye are asked to go forth in the cause of Allah, ye cling heavily to the earth? Do ye prefer the life of this world to the Hereafter? But little is the comfort of this life, as compared with the Hereafter. Unless ye go forth, He will punish you with a grievous penalty, and put others in your place." Quran (9:73) - "O Prophet! strive hard against the unbelievers and the hypocrites and be unyielding to them; and their abode is hell, and evil is the destination." Quran (9:123) - "O you who believe! fight those of the unbelievers who are near to you and let them find in you hardness." Quran (17:16) - "And when We wish to destroy a town, We send Our commandment to the people of it who lead easy lives, but they transgress therein; thus the word proves true against it, so We destroy it with utter destruction." Quran (21:44) - "...See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?" Quran (25:52) - "Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers, but strive against them with the utmost strenuousness with it."

comment_content.original_script:
Some folks complain vehemently about how bloated governments are around the world, yet listening to one of these protesters gives you a clue: free this and free that, i.e., health care and education, as well as free housing, a free ride, no taxes, and any other thing in life they want. Governments, especially in the west, have become bloated with bureaucracy because the citizens want to be taken care of from pre-Natal to post-Mortem. When you have millions of free loaders living on the dole and more invading nations in the western world illegally, eventually governments cannot pay for all of this simply because those who actually work and fund free welfare are outnumbered.

As for this protest, kicking out everyone in the government will solve nothing because those who want change and get in power will do everything they can to retain power. Power corrupts!

comment_content.original_script:
People in the West are oversaturated with news stories (every fart of one of our domestic politicians gets artificially inflated in significance by the media), so it's often a matter of not having the time to read up on every protest/regime out there. Once something does make the headlines (e.g. Hong Kong), every media outlet will jump on that story, because they need the clicks/readers (newspapers are still dying).
Why Hong Kong? Because China is looking like the next global superpower and everybody is apprehensive of a country that actively develops new technology (e.g. gait analysis) to monitor people literally everywhere. In other words, the Chinese party dictatorship seems more dangerous than any old one-man-show dictatorship (those have a tendency to fall eventually, e.g. Mubarak in Egypt, Gaddafi in Libya, etc.). Also, Europeans, specifically, are very concerned with Turkey and Russia right now, which are much closer to home and seem to be doing whatever they please.
There are so many other protests deserving of our attention:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Ongoing_protests
Also, remember this? -->https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Drug_War
I know that doesn't excuse the self-centered way in which Europe choses which protests to focus on. Anyway, I hope this explains why we don't show our support for every cause.



TL;DR: too many dictatorships to deal with them all; local media focusing on often insignificant domestic issues.
